poem:
TikTok Curry

In the pot, spices dance—  
red chillies, bay's curve,  
cardamom whispers,  
onions drawn fine,  
sizzle a song  
over ghee's warm pool.  
Steam rises, fragrant,  
embracing distance—  
a taste of home,  
screen-glow comfort,  
students' murmured wish,  
*be my mum*.  
In pixels, solace stirs—  
rice joins a curry's embrace.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "‘Can you be my mum?’ Students turn to TikTok for a taste of home Monica Singh adds whole red chillies, cloves, cardamom, a bay leaf and finely chopped onions to a searing pot of ghee. The base of her coconut chicken curry crackles and sizzles in the pot. The results, spooned over basmati rice, are thick, warm and extremely comforting – or at least that’s how they look on TikTok. Singh, who works in sales". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
